programme.title: Secrets Of Wild India

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: In the heart of Tanzania, the towering walls of the Ngorongoro crater sets a stage for one of the most infamous rivalries in the natural world. The sisters of a formidable lion pride clash with a hyena clan ruled by an all-powerful queen. The sisterhood share responsibility, while the hyena queen must play clan politics and enforce a strict hierarchy to keep her crown.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: Under the rainforest canopy of Central America is a secret world ruled by insects. Two tiny queens will give everything to build their empires. The ant queen will sacrifice her own body for the future of her growing colony while the beautiful orchid bee will stop at nothing for success; betraying those closest to her.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The Congo Forest in Central Africa is home to a secretive animal we still know very little about. Bonobos are one of our closest relatives, but in their society it‚Äôs females who rule. A young bonobo must leave behind her family, to find her place in the world. Here, friendship is the key to survival. She must make new friends and impress the alpha female before she can truly fit in.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Fair is in full swing! Getting to this day took months of hard work from vets and kids to get the Fair animals in tip top shape. Even after the Fair opens, the vets are on call to treat any emergency that pops up. Dr. Pol treats a goat with a torn ear as Dr. Lisa examines a limping cow. At the clinic, Dr. Nicole is tireless in her effort to save the life of a beloved dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol searches for clues to why a python has lumps under her skin. Dr. Nicole discovers the surprising cause of a cat‚Äôs sky-high fever, and Dr. Lisa sutures a dog‚Äôs puncture wound. In the parking lot, alpacas get their shots and a goose gets loose. Dr. Pol is asked by a local baseball team to throw out the first pitch. To warm up his arm, Dr. Pol plays catch with Charles and Abigail.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Join affable presenter Nigel Marven as he discovers the colourful and varied wildlife of Costa Rica. Meet Scarlet Macaws on the Osa Peninsula, playful Spotted Dolphins in the Gulf of Dulce, a 'Christmas Tree' Eyelash Palm Pitviper, baby Leatherback Turtles on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast and a group of colourful kings in the north of the country.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Nigel Marven explores the stunningly beautiful country of Guatemala, uncovering a wealth of wildlife, dramatic scenery and ancient Maya history along the way. Join him to see the world's most beautiful lake, Central America's most colourful pitviper and incredible views from the 'top of the Maya world'. There are Quetzals, jays and orchids in the cloud forests and venomous lizards in the arid interior.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It‚Äôs winter on the farm, and the Pol‚Äôs are adding to their flock! The family is bringing in four merino ewes that were recently bred, which means with any luck the farm could be expecting its first lambs come springtime. And as winter fades into spring, the Pol‚Äôs prepare for the new arrivals by building a lambing pen. Meanwhile, Beth checks if her bees survived the winter.

programme.title: Outback Wrangler
programme.desc: With 2-fingered Tommy Nichols from Parks & Wildlife, Matt builds the largest trap he's ever made to catch one of the largest crocodiles caught in Australia..

programme.title: Outback Wrangler
programme.desc: In the 1970's Lizzie Downs was popular for being the place to find huge crocs. Over the past years they've had a chance to re-bound.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Predators
programme.desc: Our rivers and oceans are ruthless battlefields, constantly testing the bravery of even the biggest and deadliest carnivores. Regardless of temperature, depth or terrain, every marine habitat calls for unique body designs, exquisitely evolved senses, and outrageously complex - or bizarre - tactics for success.

programme.title: Madagascar's Weirdest
programme.desc: Madagascar's creatures have developed some of the strangest survival methods Mother Nature has to offer..

programme.title: Secret Life of Predators
programme.desc: The hunters are forced to specialize, develop unexpected strategies and display incredible fortitude. Our perception of some of the most iconic predators will be turned upside down, and we'll be introduced to a few surprising carnivores.

programme.title: Madagascar's Weirdest

programme.title: Madagascar's Weirdest
programme.desc: Madagascar is an island nation set adrift for millions of years, leaving its wildlife in extreme isolation and causing some bizarre adaptations. Many of the creatures here are found nowhere else on earth. From the feared fossa to the mysterious aye-aye, and a variety of lemurs, in Madagascar, being weird is a way of life.

programme.title: Wild Alaska
programme.desc: The rugged coast of our biggest state harbors the most incredible wildlife in America. When winter breaks, animals make the most of the endless sunshine before this world closes again in darkness. This is the story of the creatures that endure this harsh reality along the shoreline Alaskas life on the edge.

programme.title: Secret Life of Predators
programme.desc: The hunters are forced to specialize, develop unexpected strategies and display incredible fortitude. Our perception of some of the most iconic predators will be turned upside down, and we'll be introduced to a few surprising carnivores.

programme.title: Secret Life of Predators
programme.desc: Worldwide, predators that inhabit open spaces must hide in plain sight in order to thrive. On the vast plains of the African savanna, banded mongooses rely on strength in numbers in order to succeed in a land of giants. .

programme.title: Secret Life of Predators
programme.desc: If you're a forest predator, success requires using trees to bridge the gap between life and death. In this realm, danger - or your next meal - could be behind you, below, or above you. Whether you're a Harpy eagle, zeroing in on prey from high in the rainforest canopy, a cunning weasel, scouring for a meal in and out of mossy logs, or a Bengal tiger, trying to stalk in a bare, dry forest, catching prey among the trees is a challenge.

programme.title: Secret Life of Predators
programme.desc: Combat in the sea takes viewers into the ocean's sparkling, tropical reefs ‚Ä¶ and rough open water. In our planet's liquid space, predators of all shapes and sizes face incredible obstacles to success - and survival, because underwater battlefields test the mettle of even the biggest and deadliest carnivores.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Predators
programme.desc: Our rivers and oceans are ruthless battlefields, constantly testing the bravery of even the biggest and deadliest carnivores. Regardless of temperature, depth or terrain, every marine habitat calls for unique body designs, exquisitely evolved senses, and outrageously complex - or bizarre - tactics for success.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Armed with a bucket and tube, Dr. Pol works tirelessly to help a horse struggling with choke. Inside the clinic, Dr. Lisa tackles the many maladies of Mushi the cat, and Dr. Brenda treats a fussy feline. Something odd happens when Doc meets another DocDr. Strange the steer. Charles is worried about his dog Athena and looks to his dad for guidance. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: With an ultrasound for a bearded dragon and wound care for a goose, the to-do list never ends. Dr. Lisa has back-to-back pup emergencies. Dr. Pol and Dr. Brenda team up to answer an emergency farm call, and Dr. Nicole gives TLC to a stray kitty. While the clinic staff takes care of business in MI, Dr. Pol proudly escorts U.S. veterans to Washington, D.C. with the Mid-Michigan Honor Flight.

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Seven hundred miles off the coast of Ecuador lies a collection of volcanic islands that harbor some of the strangest living things to ever exist. These are the Galapagos Islands.Emerging from beneath the ocean more than 20 million years ago, life here has evolved in isolation to give rise to an astonishing variety of creatures, many found nowhere else on the planet. .

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Two islands are the last strongholds for Southeast Asia's rainforests. Borneo and Sumatra each harbor some of the most unique yet elusive species on Earth. From pygmy elephants to giant trees, flying lizards to swinging red apes, the battle for space influences all. .
